paper_abstract: A twodimensional code of pictures is defined as a set X subset of Sigma** such that any picture over Sigma is tilable in at most one way with pictures in X. It is proved that in general it is undecidable whether a finite set of picture is a code. The subclass of prefix codes is introduced and it is proved that it is decidable whether a finite set of pictures is a prefix code. :Further a polynomial time decoding algorithm for finite prefix codes is given. Maximality and completeness of finite prefix codes are studied.
paper_title: PREFIX PICTURE CODES: A DECIDABLE CLASS OF TWO-DIMENSIONAL CODES
